intro: Monanthotaxis quasilanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf monanthotaxis, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Anacardiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lanceolate leaves that are often arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native range.
